trans-unit.source: Sweep Parameters
trans-unit.target: Sweep Parameters

trans-unit.source: Performs a parameter sweep on a model to determine the optimum parameter settings
trans-unit.target: Performs a parameter sweep on a model to determine the optimum parameter settings

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="A85A6491-FE78-4461-BA01-2F798A9E3927" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Train</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="A85A6491-FE78-4461-BA01-2F798A9E3927" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Train</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module to build and test models using different combinations of settings, in order to determine the optimum parameters for the given prediction task and data.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module to build and test models using different combinations of settings, in order to determine the optimum parameters for the given prediction task and data.

trans-unit.source: There are several ways that you can use <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>:
trans-unit.target: There are several ways that you can use <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Integrated train and sweep</embeddedLabel>: You can train any model using <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Integrated train and sweep</embeddedLabel>: You can train any model using <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>.

trans-unit.source: However, some machine learning algorithms provide the ability to specify which parameters to sweep over during the training process.
trans-unit.target: However, some machine learning algorithms provide the ability to specify which parameters to sweep over during the training process.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Notes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for a list of all algorithms that support a integrated parameter sweep.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Notes" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section for a list of all algorithms that support a integrated parameter sweep.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Cross validation mode:</embeddedLabel> You can use <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> to divide your data into some number of folds and then perform tests on the models for each fold, while performing a parameter sweep to identify the best parameters.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Cross validation mode:</embeddedLabel> You can use <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> to divide your data into some number of folds and then perform tests on the models for each fold, while performing a parameter sweep to identify the best parameters.

trans-unit.source: This method provides the best accuracy but can take longer to train.
trans-unit.target: This method provides the best accuracy but can take longer to train.

trans-unit.source: With both methods, you get an accuracy report describing the different models that were created, plus a trained model that you can save for re-use.
trans-unit.target: With both methods, you get an accuracy report describing the different models that were created, plus a trained model that you can save for re-use.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure Sweep Parameters
trans-unit.target: How to Configure Sweep Parameters

trans-unit.source: To train a model using a parameter sweep
trans-unit.target: To train a model using a parameter sweep

trans-unit.source: Add the <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module to your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Add the <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module to your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Connect an untrained learner to the leftmost input.
trans-unit.target: Connect an untrained learner to the leftmost input.

trans-unit.source: If the model supports an integrated parameter sweep, set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui> and use the <ui>Range Builder</ui> to specify a range of values to use in the parameter sweep.
trans-unit.target: If the model supports an integrated parameter sweep, set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui> and use the <ui>Range Builder</ui> to specify a range of values to use in the parameter sweep.

trans-unit.source: You don’t need to specify a range for all values.
trans-unit.target: You don’t need to specify a range for all values.

trans-unit.source: You can fix one or more parameters at a certain value manually and then sweep over the remaining parameters.
trans-unit.target: You can fix one or more parameters at a certain value manually and then sweep over the remaining parameters.

trans-unit.source: This might save some computation time.
trans-unit.target: This might save some computation time.

trans-unit.source: Add the dataset you want to use for cross-validation and connect it to the middle input of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Add the dataset you want to use for cross-validation and connect it to the middle input of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If you have a tagged dataset, you can connect it to the rightmost input port (<ui>Optional validation dataset</ui>) to use in measuring accuracy.
trans-unit.target: If you have a tagged dataset, you can connect it to the rightmost input port (<ui>Optional validation dataset</ui>) to use in measuring accuracy.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Properties</ui> pane of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>, set options that define the number of parameters used and the number of iterations.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Properties</ui> pane of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>, set options that define the number of parameters used and the number of iterations.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Random sweep</ui> option, specify the maximum number of runs that you want the module to execute.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Random sweep</ui> option, specify the maximum number of runs that you want the module to execute.

trans-unit.source: The module will randomly select parameter values over a system-defined range.
trans-unit.target: The module will randomly select parameter values over a system-defined range.

trans-unit.source: This option is useful for cases where you want to increase model performance using the metrics of your choice and conserve computing resources.
trans-unit.target: This option is useful for cases where you want to increase model performance using the metrics of your choice and conserve computing resources.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Grid sweep</ui> option, the module loops over a grid predefined by the system to try different combinations and identify the best learner.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Grid sweep</ui> option, the module loops over a grid predefined by the system to try different combinations and identify the best learner.

trans-unit.source: This option is useful for cases where you don't know what the best parameter settings might be and want to try many parameters.
trans-unit.target: This option is useful for cases where you don't know what the best parameter settings might be and want to try many parameters.

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Label column</ui>, launch the column selector to choose a single label column.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Label column</ui>, launch the column selector to choose a single label column.

trans-unit.source: Choose a single metric to use when assessing the best model.
trans-unit.target: Choose a single metric to use when assessing the best model.

trans-unit.source: Although there are two options that list available metrics, one for regression and one for classification, the values that are actually returned depend on what type of model you are sweeping.
trans-unit.target: Although there are two options that list available metrics, one for regression and one for classification, the values that are actually returned depend on what type of model you are sweeping.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you sweep a regression model, all applicable metrics are returned in the report, but the metric you selected is the one that is used to rank the models and identify the best one.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you sweep a regression model, all applicable metrics are returned in the report, but the metric you selected is the one that is used to rank the models and identify the best one.

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module outputs a set of evaluation results, indicating the parameters that produced the best models, and their accuracy.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module outputs a set of evaluation results, indicating the parameters that produced the best models, and their accuracy.

trans-unit.source: The right-hand output (<ui>Trained best model</ui>) contains a trained model that uses the optimal parameters.
trans-unit.target: The right-hand output (<ui>Trained best model</ui>) contains a trained model that uses the optimal parameters.

trans-unit.source: You can click <ui>View Results</ui> and review the parameters and accuracy values, or you can click the output and select <ui>Save as Trained Model</ui> to use it for scoring in other experiments.
trans-unit.target: You can click <ui>View Results</ui> and review the parameters and accuracy values, or you can click the output and select <ui>Save as Trained Model</ui> to use it for scoring in other experiments.

trans-unit.source: To perform cross-validation with a parameter sweep
trans-unit.target: To perform cross-validation with a parameter sweep

trans-unit.source: Add the <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module to your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Add the <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module to your experiment.

trans-unit.source: Connect an untrained learner to the leftmost input.
trans-unit.target: Connect an untrained learner to the leftmost input.

trans-unit.source: If the model supports an integrated parameter sweep, set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui> and use the <ui>Range Builder</ui> to specify a range of values to use in the parameter sweep.
trans-unit.target: If the model supports an integrated parameter sweep, set the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option to <ui>Parameter Range</ui> and use the <ui>Range Builder</ui> to specify a range of values to use in the parameter sweep.

trans-unit.source: You don’t need to specify a range for all values.
trans-unit.target: You don’t need to specify a range for all values.

trans-unit.source: You can fix one or more parameters at a certain value manually and then sweep over the remaining parameters.
trans-unit.target: You can fix one or more parameters at a certain value manually and then sweep over the remaining parameters.

trans-unit.source: This might save some computation time.
trans-unit.target: This might save some computation time.

trans-unit.source: Add the dataset you want to use for cross-validation.
trans-unit.target: Add the dataset you want to use for cross-validation.

trans-unit.source: Do not connect it to <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> yet; you need to divide the data into folds for cross-validation first.
trans-unit.target: Do not connect it to <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> yet; you need to divide the data into folds for cross-validation first.

trans-unit.source: Add the <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sample and partition</link> module, and connect your dataset.
trans-unit.target: Add the <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sample and partition</link> module, and connect your dataset.

trans-unit.source: Choose the <ui>Assign to Fold</ui> option and optionally specify some number of folds to divide the data into.
trans-unit.target: Choose the <ui>Assign to Fold</ui> option and optionally specify some number of folds to divide the data into.

trans-unit.source: By default, the parameter sweep performs 10-fold cross validation, with a random split.
trans-unit.target: By default, the parameter sweep performs 10-fold cross validation, with a random split.

trans-unit.source: However, you can create a different number of folds.
trans-unit.target: However, you can create a different number of folds.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify that stratified random sampling be used.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify that stratified random sampling be used.

trans-unit.source: In that case, you must specify the column that contains the values for stratification.
trans-unit.target: In that case, you must specify the column that contains the values for stratification.

trans-unit.source: Connect the output of <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sample and partition</link> to the middle input of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Connect the output of <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sample and partition</link> to the middle input of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You don’t need to connect a validation dataset to the rightmost input of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> – for cross-validation you just need a training dataset.
trans-unit.target: You don’t need to connect a validation dataset to the rightmost input of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> – for cross-validation you just need a training dataset.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties pane of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>, set parameters that determine how the sweep is performed.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties pane of <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui>, set parameters that determine how the sweep is performed.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module outputs a set of evaluation results, indicating the parameters that produced the best models, and their accuracy.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module outputs a set of evaluation results, indicating the parameters that produced the best models, and their accuracy.

trans-unit.source: The accuracy metrics are calculated from the cross-validation pass, and may vary slightly depending on how many folds you selected.
trans-unit.target: The accuracy metrics are calculated from the cross-validation pass, and may vary slightly depending on how many folds you selected.

trans-unit.source: The right-hand output (<ui>Trained best model</ui>) contains a trained model that uses the optimal parameters.
trans-unit.target: The right-hand output (<ui>Trained best model</ui>) contains a trained model that uses the optimal parameters.

trans-unit.source: You can click the output and select <ui>Save as Trained Model</ui> to use it for scoring in other experiments.
trans-unit.target: You can click the output and select <ui>Save as Trained Model</ui> to use it for scoring in other experiments.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how parameter sweeping is used in machine learning, see these experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how parameter sweeping is used in machine learning, see these experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Prediction of student performance</linkText><linkUri>https://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/da44bcd5dc2d4e059ebbaf94527d3d5b</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the <link xlink:href="e3c522f8-53d9-4829-8ea4-5c6a6b75330c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Boosted Decision Tree Regression</link> algorithm with different parameters to generate a model with the best possible root mean squared error (RMSE).
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Prediction of student performance</linkText><linkUri>https://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/da44bcd5dc2d4e059ebbaf94527d3d5b</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses the <link xlink:href="e3c522f8-53d9-4829-8ea4-5c6a6b75330c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Boosted Decision Tree Regression</link> algorithm with different parameters to generate a model with the best possible root mean squared error (RMSE).

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Learning with Counts: Binary Classification</linkText><linkUri>https://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/47deb75fc7bb428194e9d0d5713350c8</linkUri></externalLink> sample generates a compact set of features using count-based learning, and then applies a parameter sweep to find the best model parameters.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Learning with Counts: Binary Classification</linkText><linkUri>https://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/47deb75fc7bb428194e9d0d5713350c8</linkUri></externalLink> sample generates a compact set of features using count-based learning, and then applies a parameter sweep to find the best model parameters.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Binary Classification: Network intrusion detection</linkText><linkUri>https://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/e7fb30de726e4e02b034233ec6c34ce4</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> in cross-validation mode, with a custom split into five folds, to find the best hyperparameters for a <link xlink:href="b0fd7660-eeed-43c5-9487-20d9cc79ed5d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Logisitc Regression</link> model.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Binary Classification: Network intrusion detection</linkText><linkUri>https://gallery.azureml.net/Experiment/e7fb30de726e4e02b034233ec6c34ce4</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> in cross-validation mode, with a custom split into five folds, to find the best hyperparameters for a <link xlink:href="b0fd7660-eeed-43c5-9487-20d9cc79ed5d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Logisitc Regression</link> model.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module iterates over the parameters available on the model and outputs multiple combinations of settings, and captures metrics for each parameter.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Sweep Parameters</ui> module iterates over the parameters available on the model and outputs multiple combinations of settings, and captures metrics for each parameter.

trans-unit.source: The module identifies the best trained model as determined by the user-selected metric, using the given training and validation datasets.
trans-unit.target: The module identifies the best trained model as determined by the user-selected metric, using the given training and validation datasets.

trans-unit.source: Metrics used for Validation
trans-unit.target: Metrics used for Validation

trans-unit.source: For a definition of the metrics that are provided for each type of model, see <link xlink:href="ea496474-d04c-474f-896f-3f4531cd8be0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a definition of the metrics that are provided for each type of model, see <link xlink:href="ea496474-d04c-474f-896f-3f4531cd8be0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Evaluate</link>.
